item.title: Perplexity sees India as a shortcut in its race against OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Perplexity is quietly expanding into India to compete with OpenAI in the next phase of AI adoption.

item.title: ‘Utopian’ city California Forever announces huge tech manufacturing park
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Solano Foundry is a 2,100-acre manufacturing park that can host 40 million square feet of advanced tech manufacturing space.

item.title: Anthropic tightens usage limits for Claude Code – without telling users
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Claude Code users have been hit with unexpectedly restrictive usage limits. The problems, many of which have been aired on Claude Code’s GitHub page, seem to be concentrated among heavy users of the service, many of whom are on the $200-a-month Max plan.

item.title: Microsoft is buying tons of carbon removal from Xprize startup Vaulted Deep
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Microsoft's data center boom has been imperiling its 2030 carbon negative pledge, so the tech giant is turning to Vaulted Deep, which operates like a reverse oil company.

item.title: Hadrian raises $260M to build out automated factories for space and defense parts
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: Hadrian wants to revolutionize American manufacturing through automation.

item.title: After raising over $3M, popular VC-backed beauty brand Ami Colé is shuttering
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Diarrha N'Diaye-Mbaye, one of the first among the small number of Black women to raise more than $1 million in venture capital, hinted that one of the problems was tension between her and investors' expectations of a consumer retail business.

item.title: OpenAI launches a general purpose agent in ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI announced the launch of ChatGPT agent, which the company claims to be its most capable AI agent product yet.

item.title: Twitch starts testing vertical video streams
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Twitch's tests are not widespread at this point, as AppSensa's research only found a handful of references in the app's code that mentioned the tests would focus on just "a few streamers" for the time being.

item.title: Meta appoints generative AI VP to run Threads
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Meta appointed Connor Hayes, Meta's VP of product for generative AI, to become the head of Threads.

item.title: Rivian restarting work on its Georgia factory, emails show
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The project has created 46 full-time jobs so far. Rivian will begin installing “deep utilities” in August, with “vertical construction” set to begin in the first quarter of 2026.

item.title: Substack raises $100M from Chernin Group, Andreessen Horowitz, Skims CEO, and more
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The New York Times reports that the funding brings Substack's valuation to $1.1 billion, almost 70% higher than its 2021 valuation of $650 million.

item.title: Hackers are trying to steal passwords and sensitive data from users of Signal clone
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The bug in the modified messaging app can expose users' “plaintext usernames, passwords, and other sensitive data,” per GreyNoise.

item.title: Boulevard raises $80M to power self-care boom driven by Botox and GLP-1 surge
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Boulevard's revenue soared over 500% in the last three years, partly driven by a burgeoning new client segment: med spas. The company estimates that it is powering approximately 15% of all medspas in the U.S.

item.title: Zuckerberg and Meta investors reach settlement in $8B privacy case
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The shareholders' lawsuit alleges Facebook execs intentionally violated an FTC agreement by sharing user data with third-party apps without user consent.

item.title: Mistral’s Le Chat chatbot gets a productivity push with new ‘deep research’ mode
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: French AI lab Mistral introduced a range of new features to its Le Chat chatbot on Thursday that bring it closer to the capabilities of rivals like OpenAI and Google. The new update includes a “deep research” mode, native multilingual reasoning, and advanced image editing.

item.title: Confident Security, ‘the Signal for AI,’ comes out of stealth with $4.2M
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: San Francisco-based startup Confident Security wants to be “the Signal for AI." The company just came out of stealth with $4.2 million and a tool that wraps around AI models to guarantee data stays private.

item.title: North Korean hackers blamed for record spike in crypto thefts in 2025
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Chainalysis said crypto thefts during the first half of 2025 were at record levels, thanks in large part to a single breach at a major crypto exchange.

item.title: Spotify expands audiobook access to family plan members for the first time
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify is expanding access to audiobooks with two new plans, one of which offers access to family members.

item.title: UAE’s deal to buy Nvidia AI chips reportedly on hold
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The U.S. is reportedly holding up the deal due to concerns that AI chips could be smuggled to China from the UAE.

item.title: Uber makes multimillion-dollar investment in Lucid and Nuro to build a premium robotaxi service
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Uber is investing hundreds of millions of dollars into Lucid and autonomous vehicle technology startup Nuro in a bid to launch its own robotaxi service.
